knimeNode.name: Spark Partitioning
knimeNode.shortDescription: Splits input data into two partitions.

fullDescription.intro: The input data is split into two partitions (i.e. row-wise), e.g. train and test data. The two partitions are available at the two output ports. The following options are available in the dialog:
fullDescription.option: Specify the absolute number of rows in the sample. If there are less rows than specified here, all rows are used.
The percentage of the number of rows in the sample. Must be between 0 and 100, inclusively.
This mode selects the top most rows of the input data.
Random sampling of all rows, you may optionally specify a fixed seed (see below).

Check this button if you want stratified sampling, i.e. the distribution of values in the selected column is (approximately) retained in the output table. You may optionally specify a fixed seed (see below).
Exact sampling requires significant more resources than the per-stratum simple random sampling used in by default, but will provide the exact sampling size with 99.99% confidence.

If either random or stratified sampling is selected, you may enter a fixed seed here in order to get reproducible results upon re-execution. If you do not specify a seed, a new random seed is taken for each execution.
If selected a row from the input data can be chosen more than once.

ports.inPort: Spark RDD to take the sample from.
